Matthew Stafford's wife Kelly opens up about daughter Tyler's 'adorable' interest in learning football Discuss Now Kelly Stafford opens up about daughter Tyler's 'adorable' interest in learning football (Image Source: Kelly/IG) Los Angeles Rams star Matthew Stafford's kids have started to develop an interest in the sport their father plays. Recently, the quarterback's wife, Kelly Stafford opened up about daughter Tyler's surging interest in watching and learning about NFL.
In the new episode of "The Morning After" podcast released on Wednesday, Kelly recalled how her daughter, Tyler, snuggled with her to watch the Los Angeles Rams beat the New York Jets in the Week 17 clash. Describing how Tyler kept on asking so many "questions" about the game, Kelly said:
"I love that Tyler asked if she could snuggle and watch the game with me last night. I was like 'Oh my God,' and she had questions. She was just like 'Mommy, why do they tackle that guy, like why don't they tackle everyone? Like why does the guy carrying the ball?' Trending •

"I was like, 'Well, he has the ball and so, you know you want to get him to the ground cuz then the play is over.' And she was like, 'Well, why doesn't he just give the ball to somebody else when he gets tackled?' You know she's asking these questions and it's freaking adorable," Kelly concluded. (27:52) Talking about kids, Kelly Stafford previously confessed about cursing around her kids while watching Rams games.
Matthew Stafford's wife Kelly feels no 'guilt' for swearing around kids In an episode of "The Morning After" podcast on Dec. 10, Kelly Stafford opened up about using "bad words" around her kids, especially while watching LA Rams' games. Talking about how she doesn't regret cussing around them, Kelly said:
"You marry someone who loves sports, who's competitive like Matthew is, I'm sure he was down there cussing up a storm and I was in the suite cussing up a storm. Now my kids are used to it. They know those are adult words. We've talked about this. So I don't feel bad doing it in front of them." (27:43)
"I think Tyler said 'sh*t' when she was two. But other than that, and it was one time and I was like, 'Absolutely not.' Other than that, they know. Then on my belief, you're going to hear these words from people like me, who are, you're not expecting and I don't want you ever to repeat them, you know," Kelly concluded. Kelly Stafford has been quite open about sharing her personal life on her podcast. After her previous confession of using therapy , the podcaster recently revealed that she has been battling with sleep issues.
